bow: am not good mom today have lost my temper way too many times on my month old who is usually very chill but has been screaming needy non stop and not ducking sleeping dark dark thoughts tired don kids to cry that it ok for them to feel emotions and to work through them yes comfort them in the hard times let them know you re there and do what you can if there is physical need like food diaper changes uncomfortable clothing teething pain etc but you can only do so much it hard on our hearts to listen to that crying because it grating but also because we want so badly to provide our children with whatever it is they need but sometimes you just need to step back and walk away you matter too and crying won hurt your child know you re good mom because you recognize when you re not at your best get break it ok to ask for help it does not make weak it makes you good mom to take care of yourself you can do this or teething remember going through this with my first take deep breath and know that it going to be okay know being mom takes mental toll but we can do this have you tried putting baby in bathtub give baby nice bath and then try changing baby in quiet dark place feed baby if he or she wants to and then put baby in bed baby is safe and you can take some time for yourself it okay to leave baby for little while even let baby cry him or herself to sleep baby is clean new diaper fed and safe relax and don give up baby is just baby good luck this is some great advice right here op it is ok to ask for help and it ok to admit you are struggling with some though things these are normal feelings that tons of new moms have so don feel guilty and don let yourself be tricked into believing you aren good mom talking with someone can make huge difference struggled with mom because you care about how your baby and want to be doing good job some moms and dads only care about their own needs am there with you mine is months and on her fussiest days it just is so hard yesterday swear she did go more than 30 seconds without fussing because of teething sometimes you do just have to put them in safe place and walk away for bit it is going to scar them and if you can just reading some posts from other moms is helping too on my bad days when my husband came home from work would leave and go to target for an hour walked around the entire store and still ended up in the baby section my daughter at months was screamer non stop because of teething and feel you on those bad days mama my daughter also got better with her emotions around months but every night she still melts down and gets screamy it hard but there nothing wrong with telling your partner you need break and head out for an hour or go upstairs and do some self care and take break love this your still good mom even with loosing your cool don know of mom who doesn have and year old and just the other day it was full of loosing my patience with the tantrums and crying totally get it and you will have more of those days it will happen cuddles and kisses also happen it balances out the days where you can take it in many areas there are anonymous parent hotlines see if there one in the area one in my neighborhood made parenting less lonely during those early toddler autistic meltdown days where needed to lock myself in the bathroom so would lose my temper therapist from there asked my permission to call me every week to check on me for free we all feel this way sometimes even if are always brave enough to admit it just strive for the good days to outweigh the bad you and your baby will be just fine just quick story that might help you feel better had one of these days few weeks back with our now month old and was really down on everything was doing forgot something for our drive to the library and when my 3yo asked for it snapped and snippily said forgot it ok bad mommy the most serious voice she just says no mommy that ok you re not bad mommy you re just good mommy literally cried all the way to the library we are honestly so hard on ourselves as mothers when at the end of the day our children think the world of us even when we feel like we re at rock bottom give yourself break because that baby loves you even at your worst we had this issue too it was teething every time and it took me all her teeth to catch on seriously our usually sweet fun happy kid would just be so difficult and needy and horrible company and we take like personal offence to it next morning new tooth like ohhh makes sense every time feel like crap because put her to bed hurting crying and could have given her some baby tylenol or something to help her feel better when my baby was months were the absolute worst of my life she just did sleep remember once she was howling and angry if put her down was breastfeeding and struggled to pump enough so my husband could really help put her in playpen and she just cried and cried so crawled in there with her laid down in fetal position and ate an entire box of nilla wafers my only advice is just when you think you ca possibly take one more day they will grow up bit and be on to the next stage spot on one of the things our kids need most is sane and healthy parent walking away for bit is sometimes the only way to provide that hang in there mama it will get so much easier putting baby in safe place such as crib amp walking away to compose yourself is tried amp true survival method of motherhood probably did it weekly during the hard months of when mine were littles walk away sob all my frustrations out into my pillow then walk back with just enough composure to survive one more hour day week repeat as needed just another person here to say see you hear you and you are not terrible mom it is hard and you are surviving some days that is as good as it gets and that is totally fine hope tomorrow is better day for both of you constantly felt like we made mistake having my first kid for months just cried and cried and missed my old carefree yet lazy life one day it just clicked and everything felt way easier then it like forgot all about that and decided to have another kid she months old and still feel like why did do this love her she an amazing baby just feel this immense guilt that my time and love are split between them now and my toddler doesn get what he needs anymore just waiting for the day that it clicks again and hope it soon this guess what doing just hanging out with my month old since 3am it 4:29am now thank you for sharing currently walking laps around my living room while wearing my teething baby he so fussy and this helped remind me that everything will be ok we all have moments like this you are not bad mom not at all tomorrow is new day that how was for the first months of my daughter life hours spent every night trying to nurse her rock her shush her to sleep she fall asleep put her in the crib then lay on the floor why because half the time she wake up crying after 10mins or less and have to start it all over again dark thoughts in the middle of the night that may make me monster probably should have been committed if we had sleep trained her at months and if it had gone so well probably would have completely shattered instead of just cracking the newborn phase is one of many reasons why one and done do want to be that person again it okay momma the nonstop earsplitting scream of fussy baby drives everyone up wall doesn matter if it your own kid or not pick up pair of squishy foam earplugs you can still hear with them in it just dampens the high pitched tone and makes it easier to work around the noise especially if you are rocking wailing baby on your chest and it screaming in your ear when your functioning off little sleep you had bad day it doesn make you bad parent we all do our best and some times that isn as good as other times you are doing anything and everything for your baby every emotion you are feeling is justified and allowed every one am so proud of you to express yourself in any form that you can this is the village that is always here to help you and every mama out there with these days we are all doing this together ♥️ hey mama it 1241a in my time zone this is day two of baby wo sleep see you feel this issue have no answers just camaraderie in the middle of the night that is wonderful friend omg it 4:45am and up nursing my 2nd let me say it does get better huge believer in perspective it easier for me to control my emotions when know why my babies are acting certain way get the wonder weeks app it helps you see where baby is at in development so you can sympathize with them and approach patently little differently even if it just for few hours was hoping to find someone recommending the wonder weeks app book it was absolutely wonderful and incredibly helpful would prepare our household for the upcoming difficult days by writing the dates and what unusual behaviors to expect but more importantly what they re developing in that time on chalkboard in our kitchen this allowed us to be constantly reminded of what our lo was experiencing and helped shift our perspective to one of understanding and compassion rather than frustration and exhaustion it also helped us to facilitate learning environment for those recent developments it my number one recommendation for any one with new baby thank you for sharing that super sweet story made me smile she didnt give you any room to say otherwise when she said you re *just* good mommy no ifs ands or buts just good mommy thanks mama it actually is better her two bottom teeth have recently come in but think her top two are trying to get out like many other more experienced mamas have mentioned so we gave her some tylenol and she slept well we re having great morning so far and again reading yours and other comments are just making me feel very normal and confident again constantly tearing up have the app love it but it doesn seem to be working for me in the sense that it off almost weeks off right now she supposed to be in her sunny part where she happy and whatnot but it seems shes teething and has hit her cloudy part which was supposed to happen two weeks ago it must be the teeth then my toddler is teething right now and he been an emotional wrecking ball don be afraid to try some tylenol as solution if you ve tried everything else best advice ever got was to buy some noise cancelling headphones put baby on your chest and close your eyes that way babe gets the comfort and you get he quiet more often than not as soon as my son felt me calm down he did too good glad to hear it for such tiny little humans they sure can be complicated sometimes it always helps to know you are not alone when get cranky with my kids put myself in time out because we all need moment to take deep breath and try to start over fresh do overs are very important tool for all relationships it win win you get moment to take breath and your kids get nicer version of you
